transformlib package¶

Contains useful abstractions for organizing transformations of data in a modular way.

class transformlib.Input(relative_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], data_dir: Optional[Union[str, pathlib.Path]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: transformlib.node.Node

An Input is a source in a DAG of data transformations.

class transformlib.Node(relative_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], data_dir: Optional[Union[str, pathlib.Path]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Node base class is a node in a directed asyclic graph (DAG) of data transformations.

property path¶

The path to the node in the directory config.DATA_DIR.

class transformlib.Output(relative_path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], data_dir: Optional[Union[str, pathlib.Path]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: transformlib.node.Node

An Output is a sink in a DAG of data transformations.

class transformlib.Pipeline(transforms: Optional[List[transformlib.transform.Transform]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Pipeline is a topologically ordered list of transformlib.Transform objects.

A transformlib.Pipeline can be run from the command line:

transform path/to/transforms/*.py
transform -v path/to/transforms/*.py

This will topologically sort and run all transformlib.Transform objects found in the py files.

add_transforms_from_path(plugin_path: pathlib.Path) → None[source]¶

Find and import all transformlib.Transform objects from a file.

When doing this the plugin parent path is added to PATH and removed after the plugin has been searched for transformlib.Transform objects.

Assuming one has a module called transforms. Then one can then find and run all the transformlib.Transform objects in this module:

>>> from transformlib.pipeline import Pipeline
>>> pipeline = Pipeline.add_transforms_from_path('path/to/transform.py')
>>> pipeline.run()
Args:
plugin_path (Path): A path to a py file with transformlib.Transform to

be added to the Pipeline.

classmethod discover_transforms(*plugins)[source]¶

Find and import all transforms in plugins.

This function will automatically disover transforms from plugins using namespace packages e.g. fixed namespace(s), as defined by the input plugins args to the function, where plugins are saved.

Assuming one has a module called transforms. Then one can then find and run all the transformlib.Transform objects in this module:

>>> import transforms
>>> from transformlib.pipeline import Pipeline
>>> pipeline = Pipeline.discover_transforms(transforms)
>>> pipeline.run()
Args:

*plugins (module): Module(s) that contains transforms.

Returns:

Pipeline: A pipeline of the discovered transforms.

References:

[1] https://packaging.python.org/guides/creating-and-discovering-plugins/

property inputs¶

A tuple with all the Input nodes of the Pipeline.

property nodes¶

A tuple with all the Node objects of the Pipeline.

property outputs¶

A tuple with all the Output nodes of the Pipeline.

run() → None[source]¶

Used to run all the transformlib.Transform objects in the pipeline.

property tasks¶

A topologically ordered list of transforms.

class transformlib.Transform(output_kwargs, func, input_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Used to organize transformations of data.

A transformlib.Transform is a many to many mapping between transformlib.Input and transformlib.Output nodes.

A Transform is often constructed using the transformlib.transform() decorator:

import json
from transformlib import transform, Output, Input


@transform(
    json_output=Output('mapping.json'),
    txt_input=Input('mapping.txt'),
)
def convert_to_json(json_output, txt_input):
    text = txt_input.path.read_text()
    mapping = dict(map(lambda line: line.split(','), text.splitlines()))
    json_output.path.write_text(json.dumps(mapping, indent=4))
property inputs¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Input to the Transform.

property nodes¶

All transformlib.Output and transformlib.Input.

property outputs¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Output of the Transform.

run() → None[source]¶

Runs the Transform.

transformlib.transform(**kwargs: transformlib.node.Node) → transformlib.transform.Transform[source]¶

Convert a function to a transformlib.Transform.

Args:
**kwargs (Dict[str, Node]): The transformlib.Input

and transformlib.Output nodes of the transform.

Returns:

function: A decorator that returns a Transform object.

transformlib.transform module¶

class transformlib.transform.Transform(output_kwargs, func, input_kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Used to organize transformations of data.

A transformlib.Transform is a many to many mapping between transformlib.Input and transformlib.Output nodes.

A Transform is often constructed using the transformlib.transform() decorator:

import json
from transformlib import transform, Output, Input


@transform(
    json_output=Output('mapping.json'),
    txt_input=Input('mapping.txt'),
)
def convert_to_json(json_output, txt_input):
    text = txt_input.path.read_text()
    mapping = dict(map(lambda line: line.split(','), text.splitlines()))
    json_output.path.write_text(json.dumps(mapping, indent=4))
property inputs¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Input to the Transform.

property nodes¶

property outputs¶

A tuple with all the transformlib.Output of the Transform.
